paragraphs.content: Psalm 55
paragraphs.contentHtml: Psalm 55

paragraphs.content: To the chief Musician on Neginoth, Maschil, A Psalm of David.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To the chief Musician on Neginoth, Maschil, A Psalm of David.

paragraphs.content: Give ear to my prayer, O God; and hide not thyself from my supplication.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Give ear to my prayer, O God; and hide not thyself from my supplication.

paragraphs.content: Attend unto me, and hear me: I mourn in my complaint, and make a noise;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Attend unto me, and hear me: I mourn in my complaint, and make a noise;

paragraphs.content: Because of the voice of the enemy, because of the oppression of the wicked: for they cast iniquity upon me, and in wrath they hate me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Because of the voice of the enemy, because of the oppression of the wicked: for they cast iniquity upon me, and in wrath they hate me.

paragraphs.content: My heart is sore pained within me: and the terrors of death are fallen upon me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My heart is sore pained within me: and the terrors of death are fallen upon me.

paragraphs.content: Fearfulness and trembling are come upon me, and horror hath overwhelmed me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Fearfulness and trembling are come upon me, and horror hath overwhelmed me.

paragraphs.content: And I said, Oh that I had wings like a dove! for then would I fly away, and be at rest.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And I said, Oh that I had wings like a dove! for then would I fly away, and be at rest.

paragraphs.content: Lo, then would I wander far off, and remain in the wilderness. Selah.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Lo, then would I wander far off, and remain in the wilderness. Selah.

paragraphs.content: I would hasten my escape from the windy storm and tempest.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I would hasten my escape from the windy storm and tempest.

paragraphs.content: Destroy, O Lord, and divide their tongues: for I have seen violence and strife in the city.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Destroy, O Lord, and divide their tongues: for I have seen violence and strife in the city.

paragraphs.content: Day and night they go about it upon the walls thereof: mischief also and sorrow are in the midst of it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Day and night they go about it upon the walls thereof: mischief also and sorrow are in the midst of it.

paragraphs.content: Wickedness is in the midst thereof: deceit and guile depart not from her streets.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Wickedness is in the midst thereof: deceit and guile depart not from her streets.

paragraphs.content: For it was not an enemy that reproached me; then I could have borne it: neither was it he that hated me that did magnify himself against me; then I would have hid myself from him:
paragraphs.contentHtml: For it was not an enemy that reproached me; then I could have borne it: neither was it he that hated me that did magnify himself against me; then I would have hid myself from him:

paragraphs.content: But it was thou, a man mine equal, my guide, and mine acquaintance.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But it was thou, a man mine equal, my guide, and mine acquaintance.

paragraphs.content: We took sweet counsel together, and walked unto the house of God in company.
paragraphs.contentHtml: We took sweet counsel together, and walked unto the house of God in company.

paragraphs.content: Let death seize upon them, and let them go down quick into hell: for wickedness is in their dwellings, and among them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let death seize upon them, and let them go down quick into hell: for wickedness is in their dwellings, and among them.

paragraphs.content: As for me, I will call upon God; and the LORD shall save me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: As for me, I will call upon God; and the Lord shall save me.

paragraphs.content: Evening, and morning, and at noon, will I pray, and cry aloud: and he shall hear my voice.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Evening, and morning, and at noon, will I pray, and cry aloud: and he shall hear my voice.

paragraphs.content: He hath delivered my soul in peace from the battle that was against me: for there were many with me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He hath delivered my soul in peace from the battle that was against me: for there were many with me.

paragraphs.content: God shall hear, and afflict them, even he that abideth of old. Selah. Because they have no changes, therefore they fear not God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: God shall hear, and afflict them, even he that abideth of old. Selah. Because they have no changes, therefore they fear not God.

paragraphs.content: He hath put forth his hands against such as be at peace with him: he hath broken his covenant.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He hath put forth his hands against such as be at peace with him: he hath broken his covenant.

paragraphs.content: The words of his mouth were smoother than butter, but war was in his heart: his words were softer than oil, yet were they drawn swords.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The words of his mouth were smoother than butter, but war was in his heart: his words were softer than oil, yet were they drawn swords.

paragraphs.content: Cast thy burden upon the LORD, and he shall sustain thee: he shall never suffer the righteous to be moved.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Cast thy burden upon the Lord, and he shall sustain thee: he shall never suffer the righteous to be moved.

paragraphs.content: But thou, O God, shalt bring them down into the pit of destruction: bloody and deceitful men shall not live out half their days; but I will trust in thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But thou, O God, shalt bring them down into the pit of destruction: bloody and deceitful men shall not live out half their days; but I will trust in thee.
